source.author: Jeanes, J.A.
source.title: Fabaceae
source.in_title: Flora of Victoria. Vol. 3. Dicotyledons Winteraceae to Myrtaceae
source.citation: Modified from: Jeanes, J.A. (1996). Fabaceae. In: Walsh, N.G.; Entwisle, T.J. (eds), Flora of Victoria. Vol. 3. Dicotyledons Winteraceae to Myrtaceae. Inkata Press, Melbourne.

leads.lead_text: Perennial herb; stems usually unbranched, dying back to a woody root-stock over winter; leaves 9–17-foliolate; leaflets more than 10 mm wide; flowers usually purple, pink or blue
Annual herb or perennial shrub; stems much-branched; leaves 9–11-foliolate; leaflets less than 10 mm wide; flower colour various, usually yellow if plants are perennial
Plant perennial, to c. 2.5 m tall; flowers mostly arranged in whorls; pedicels more than 5 mm long; corolla bright yellow, 14–18 mm long
Plant annual; flowers alternate or whorled; pedicels less than 5 mm long; corolla usually blue, 6–15 mm long
Plant to c. 1.5 m tall; flowers mostly alternate, particularly lower down; calyx 7–9 mm long; standard 11–15 mm long; keel glabrous on upper margin near apex
Plant 10–25 cm tall; flowers mostly whorled; calyx 3.5–4.5 mm long; standard c. 6 mm long; keel ciliate on upper margin near apex
